8. See your results¶

Just looking at the json file is quite difficult to analyze, so we created a function to plot wavelengths and a 2D representation.

The script is in ‘tools/request.py’ and call ‘tools/plot_wavelength.py’ allow you to generate those representation by using the function find.

tools.request.find(config_name, starting_with='', wl_min=0, wl_max=inf, unit='nm', f_min=0.0, plot_wavelength=True)[source]

Look for the SMILES with the given parameters

Parameters:
  • config_name (str) – name of the configuration to use
  • starting_with (str) – the begging of the SMILES
  • wl_min (float) – wavelength minimum for the search
  • wl_max (float) – wavelength maximum for the search
  • unit (str) – unit of the wavelength ( “nm” , “ev” or “cm-1” )
  • f_min (float) – oscillator strength minimum for the search
  • plot_wavelength (bool) – if you want to get a plot of the wavelength or not
Returns:

None
